plugins.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
plugins.description:
Export graphics for the Twenty3 Toolbox.


How to use:

  1. Start by installing the Twenty3 Template Tagging plugin from the Resources tab in Figma
  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview
plugins.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

plugins.name: Top'n'Fix
plugins.description:
Tired of constantly switching to the prototype panel to fix a layer or frame? With the Top'n'Fix plugin, you can easily bind it to the shortcut combination of shift+opt+cmd+] and accomplish it with a single click, saving you time and effort.

Key Features:

  1. Streamlined Fixing: Instantly fix any layer or frame without the need to navigate to the prototype panel.
  2. Efficient Shortcut: Assign the shift+opt+cmd+] shortcut to quickly apply fixes with a single keystroke.


Please note that at least one object should already be fixed on the screen, fixed area in layers must be created. Hope to fix it in next version.
plugins.tagline: Fix layer, bring to the front and fix, fix frame, fix in the prototype

plugins.name: FigML - Figma XML Exporter Plugin
plugins.description:
FigML - Figma XML Exporter Plugin


Export your Figma designs to clean, structured XML. This lets you work with any programming language, any framework, and fit the code perfectly into your existing codebase. No tokens, no API calls, no headaches.


What You Get


🔍 Output That Actual Humans (and Robots) Can Read

- Preserves your Figma structure exactly as designed

- Strips away the noise: default properties and design-time clutter


🎮 Plays Nice With Everything

- Generate fresh components from scratch

- Update existing components when designs inevitably change

- Audit your component library against the latest design updates

- Create components that fit perfectly into your existing architecture

- Works with whatever you're using: React, SwiftUI, Flutter, WPF, Qt, shadcn/ui, DaisyUI, or that custom framework your team built


👑 You're the Boss

Feed the XML to any AI assistant (ChatGPT, Claude, Cursor, etc.) and get exactly the code you need. No cookie-cutter templates, no assumptions about how you like to work.


How It Works


1. Design in Figma (you're already doing this)

2. Click export (literally one click)

3. Ask your AI buddy to convert the XML

4. Ship it


Ready to stop fighting with design-to-code tools? Install FigML.


Learn more at www.figml.pro

accepted.name: FigML
accepted.description: Export Figma design to XML. Simple. Clean. Powerful.

plugins.tagline: Export Figma design to XML. Simple. Clean. Powerful.

plugins.name: FlipArabic
plugins.description:
Flip frames, change fonts, and translate copy for Arabic layouts. All with one click.

Let FlipArabic handle localization so you can focus on crafting great experiences.


Made for Your Workflow

  1. Save Time - No hours wasted on manual mirroring or font hunting.
  2. Zero Learning Curve - Select a frame or whole sections for multiple frames and convert!
  3. No Details Lost - Padding, nested auto-layouts, absolute elements, and constraints are all taken care of.
  4. Built-in Translation - AI-powered translation that keeps copy in context (big updates coming in this space).
  5. Smart Font Swapping - Auto-matches weights & styles when exact alternatives aren't available.
  6. Smart Skip for Visuals - Icons, logos, shapes, SVGs & flags keep their original direction.


Fine Tune Your Conversion

  1. Add df or don't flip to layer names to skip flipping
  2. Add dfc or don't flip content to frame names to flip position but keep contents unchanged
  3. Add dt or don't translate to text layer names to keep specific text in English
  4. Add dtc or don't translate content to parent frame names to preserve entire text blocks


For support, ideas or general feedback, reach out to fliparabic@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to Arabic instantly. Flip, change fonts & translate in one click.

  2. Zero Learning Curve - Select a frame or whole sections for multiple frames and convert!
  3. No Details Lost - Padding, nested auto-layouts, absolute elements, and constraints are all taken care of.
  4. Built-in Translation - AI-powered translation that keeps copy in context (big updates coming in this space).
  5. Smart Font Swapping - Auto-matches weights & styles when exact alternatives aren't available.

For support, ideas or general feedback, reach out to fliparabic@gmail.com

138048.tagline: Convert your designs to Arabic instantly. Flip, change fonts & translate in one click.

plugins.name: Variable Calculator
plugins.description:
Easily calculate variable values

Use Variable Calculator to apply math formulas, recalculating your variables. Apply to en entire collection, specific group, or specific mode. Great for scaling numbers for responsive behavior.


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Enter the formula to apply to the variables
  5. Calculate!


Tip

  1. Use a, b, c, n, v, x, $ or value to reference the current variable value.
  2. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  3. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  4. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Run math operations on your variable values!

You can use them freely for personal and commercial projects, with no attribution required.


Modify them, remix them, use them in client work or side projects — no strings attached.


All icons are available in a single Figma file to make browsing and copying super easy (using the file you can customize the corner radii).

plugins.name: Big-Tech Style Design Challenges
plugins.description:
✨ Figma Plugin Description

Practice real-world design challenges directly inside Figma.

Sharpen your product thinking and UX skills with guided prompts and exercises — perfect for designers prepping for interviews or just looking to stay sharp.


🌐 What is Designus?

When you submit your solution via the plugin, your work gets published to the Designus platform — where you can explore other designers' answers and learn from diverse approaches.

Use the plugin to focus on solving the challenge, and head to the website to review and reflect on submitted solutions.


🛠 How to Use the Plugin

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Choose a challenge from the calendar
  3. Click Import to add the challenge & solution frame to your canvas
  4. Design your solution directly inside Figma
  5. Reopen the plugin and go to Export Solution
  6. Select your solution frame and write a short description
  7. Click Export to submit your answer
  8. Go to Designus website to review your submission and check out others' solutions.
plugins.tagline: Design Challenges - Level up your design skills through real design challenges.

131471.name: Big-Tech Style Design Challenges
131471.description:

Use the plugin to focus on solving the challenge, and head to the website to review and reflect on submitted solutions.

plugins.name: Console CLI
plugins.description:
Console CLI lets you control Figma using commands. You can list fonts, styles, and components, create shapes, get details about selected elements, check file analytics, and view user info.


Commands:

  1. help : See available commands
  2. ls : Lists data related to fonts, styles, or components
  3. ls fonts : List all fonts used in the file
  4. ls styles : List all styles used in file file
  5. ls components : List all components in the file
  6. shape : Create a new shapes based on the specified type
  7. shape rect <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create rectangle
  8. shape circle <diameter> [x] [y] : Create circle
  9. shape ellipse <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create ellipse
  10. shape polygon <sides> <radius> [x] [y] : Create polygon
  11. shape star <points> <outer-radius> <inner-radius> [x] [y] : Create star
  12. selection : Info about the currently selected nodes
  13. selection --verbose : Additional details about the selection
  14. analytics : Retrieve file analytics
  15. whoami : Retrieves info about the current user
  16. clear : Clear the console
  17. exit : Close the plugin
plugins.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

127623.name: Console CLI
127623.description:

  3. ls fonts : List all fonts used in the file
  4. ls styles : List all styles used in file file
  5. ls components : List all components in the file
  6. shape : Create a new shapes based on the specified type
  7. shape rect <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create rectangle
  8. shape circle <diameter> [x] [y] : Create circle
  9. shape ellipse <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create ellipse
  10. shape polygon <sides> <radius> [x] [y] : Create polygon

  16. clear : Clear the console

127623.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

plugins.name: Layer Formatter
plugins.description:
Streamline your design-to-development workflow with Layer Formatter, a powerful tool that simplifies layer renaming. Whether you need hyphens, underscores, camel case, or kebab case, this tool ensures your layers align perfectly with coding conventions.


Say goodbye to messy names and hello to clean, developer-friendly files. Perfect for effortless handoff and collaboration!


✨ Key Features ✨


  1. Auto-Space Conversion: Automatically replace spaces in layer names with underscores (_) or remove them entirely for clean, code-friendly naming.
  2. Batch Rename Layers: Rename multiple layers in seconds, saving time and improving efficiency.
  3. Flexible Naming Styles: Supports hyphens, underscores, camel case, kebab case, and more to fit your coding standards.
  4. Instant Updates: Apply changes with a single click—no need for tedious manual edits.
  5. Streamlined Handoff: Deliver developer-ready files with consistent, clean layer names for seamless collaboration.
plugins.tagline: Rename layers for seamless developer handoff

plugins.description:
Tailwind Text Style Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you automatically generate text styles from Google Fonts, based on Tailwind typography scale.


Tired of manually creating text styles and organizing layers one by one? This plugin does it all for you:


🎨 Choose from 1,800+ Google Fonts

📏 Auto-generate Text Styles using Tailwind-friendly sizing (sm, base, lg, xl, etc.)

⚡ Perfect for dev-design alignment especially for teams using Tailwind CSS

📁 Organized neatly: styles are grouped and named by scale

🔁 Try different fonts freely great for experimenting and iterating

💾 Instantly saved into your current design system


Whether you're building a design system or just want to speed up your workflow, this plugin makes it seamless, scalable, and developer-friendly.
plugins.tagline: 1.800 Fonts. 1 Click. Done.

plugins.name: Magic Renamer AI - With Design Token mode
plugins.description:
Magic Renamer AI is a Figma plugin that lets you automatically rename all your layers in one click (up to 120 layers at once, with design token support).


With AI, it suggests clear and consistent names that follow design and design system best practices.


🔥Key features:


  1. Smart, instant renaming: The AI analyzes your file and suggests relevant names for each layer.
  2. Time-saving: No more manual renaming—everything is done in seconds, even for large files.
  3. Clarity and consistency: Naming conventions are enforced, making teamwork easier.
  4. Simple interface: One-click use, no complicated setup. Advanced options are available if you need them.
  5. Design token support: Perfect for solo or teams using advanced design systems.
  6. Custom API support: Use your own API key (OpenAI, DeepSeek, Perplexity, or OpenRouter) for more control.


💡 Why choose Magic Renamer AI?

Unlike other plugins, Magic Renamer AI uses artificial intelligence to understand the context of each layer and suggest names tailored to your project. It ensures consistency, reduces errors, and fits seamlessly into your Figma workflow. It’s the perfect tool to save time, improve file quality, and speed up your design process.
plugins.tagline: AI-powered batch renaming for Layers — up to 120 at once -> Clarity | Consistency

plugins.name: Pixel Painter for Figma
plugins.description:
✨ What is Pixel Painter?

Bored in Figma? Need a quick brain break between design reviews? Pixel Painter lets you unleash your inner 8-bit artist right inside Figma — one pixel at a time. Think pixel art meets coffee break.


🎮 How It Works

  1. Fire up the plugin, get a random fun drawing challenge (like “Draw a cat in 1 minute” 😺).
  2. Use the color palette to fill a pixel grid — no judgment on your MS Paint skills.
  3. Timer keeps the pressure on — can you beat the clock?
  4. Save your masterpiece as PNG (complete with a cheeky watermark).


🧠 Why It Rocks

  1. 100+ non-repeating prompts keep the creativity flowing
  2. Click-to-color grid, color palette, and timer — like Figma meets Mario Paint
  3. Works inside the plugin popup — no canvas mess
  4. Great for solo play
plugins.tagline: Take a break and draw Pixels.

plugins.name: Text Paster
plugins.description:
What it does

This plugin allows you to:

  1. Select text layers from a selection
  2. Copy text strings from multiple text layers
  3. Paste text strings into multiple text layers in batch
  4. Sort text strings


How to use it

Transfer texts between frame

  1. Select a frame that contain text layers
  2. Click Copy in the plugin
  3. Select another frame that contain text layers you want to transfer the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Transfer text from Spreadsheet

  1. Copy text from a spreadsheet (Google Sheets, Excel, etc.) or any line-break-separated text.
  2. Paste it into the text box in plugin
  3. Select a frame that contain text layers you want to paste the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Delete hidden layers

  1. Select a frame
  2. Click Select "Hidden layer" (from dropdown menu)
  3. Press Delete key to delete hidden layers


-------

Kudos to AI — This plugin is the result of vibe coding with Cursor and GitHub Copilot. All the features were built just to scratch my own itches.
plugins.tagline: Trasfer text in batch with copy and paste

131151.name: Text Paster
131151.description:

-------

Kudos to AI — This plugin is the result of vibe coding with Cursor and GitHub Copilot. All the features were built just to scratch my own itches.
131151.release_notes:
- Fixed the issues that Copy and Paste buttons cannot handle directly selected text layers (previously can only select from frames)
- Improve progress bar perceived performance issue by reducing progress bar update frequency. Update progress UI every 1000 layers (previous 100). It sacrifices progress bar accuracy for better peformance
131151.tagline: Trasfer text in batch with copy and paste

plugins.name: AI Real Data Generator
plugins.description:
Description

Testing with real-life data is crucial, but setting up prototypes manually is time-consuming. With AI Real Data Generator Figma plugin, simply provide AI with your instructions and an example—using your Gemini API key, it will instantly generate and replace data in your design, making prototyping seamless and efficient.


How to Use:

  1. Add the AI Real Data Generator plugin in Figma.
  2. Enter your Gemini API key to enable data generation.
  3. Provide instructions on the type of real-life data you need.
  4. Provide an example or data template to guide AI generation.
  5. AI instantly generates and replaces data directly in your Figma design.


Key Features:


  1. Instant data generation: AI quickly fills in real-world data in seconds.
  2. Customizable: Provide specific instructions and examples to match your needs.
  3. Seamless integration: Data replaces existing placeholders in your design automatically.
  4. Efficiency boost: Save time on manual data entry during prototyping.
  5. Powered by Gemini API: Leverage advanced AI for precise data generation, enabled with the free gemini-2.0-flash modal
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma designs with real-world data using AI-powered precision

plugins.name: TDS - Persian Component Configuration Mapping
plugins.description:
Persian Converter for Alt Names

Effortlessly create component mapping for bilingual designers text in components with Persian support!


What it does

This plugin automatically converts Component configurations following "Alt. name:" lines to Persian script while preserving your original content. Perfect for designers working with multilingual interfaces or Persian localization.


Key Features


Smart Conversion

Transliterates English letters → Persian script using Persian-Standard keyboard mappings.

Converts digits → Persian numerals (۰۱۲۳)

Preserves non-Persian symbols/punctuation


Clean Workflow

  1. Purge Existing Persian - Removes all prior Persian characters/numbers from "Alt. name:" lines
  2. Convert - Transforms English characters to Persian equivalents
  3. Append - Adds converted text below original with proper spacing


Ideal For

Persian interface localization

Bilingual design systems

Teams collaborating across Latin/Persian script workflows

Maintaining clean alt-text alternatives in components

Design System Managers


Why Design System Managers will Love It:

No manual copy-pasting between lines

Prevents script mixing errors

Case-insensitive matching ("ALT. NAME:", "alt name :", etc.)

Multi-Format Support (Plain text nodes, Markdown-enabled descriptions)


-----


Coded with AI and ZERO coding knowledge :)
plugins.tagline: Maps component configuration from english keyboard to Standart persian keyboard

plugins.name: Sierotki Eliminator
plugins.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
plugins.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

105512.name: Sierotki Eliminator
105512.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
105512.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

plugins.name: Find and Replace Screens
plugins.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

114360.name: Find and Replace Screens
114360.description:

No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
114360.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

plugins.name: SVG Stroke Thickness Editor
plugins.description:
이 플러그인을 이용하면 아이콘 테두리의 두께를 일괄적으로 쉽게 변경할 수 있습니다. 깔끔한 디자인 시스템을 유지하는 데 도움이 됩니다.


• 테두리 두께의 일관성을 확인합니다.

• 일괄적으로 테두리 두께를 수정 할 수 있습니다.

• 컴포넌트 및 인스턴스와 함께 작동합니다.

• 테두리 두께를 어떻게 조정할지에 대해 세 가지 옵션 중에서 선택할 수 있습니다.


이 플러그인은 아직도 작업이 진행 중인 프로젝트입니다. 댓글과 피드백은 환영입니다!


-------------


This plugin helps you batch change icon stroke sizes so that you can maintain consistency and don't have to do it manually. Helps in maintaining a clean design system.


  1. Check for stroke size consistency.
  2. Batch change stroke sizes.
  3. Works with components and instances.
  4. Chose from 3 options as to how you want to scale your stroke sizes.


This is a work in progress. Any comments and feedback would be appreciated.

accepted.name: Ash J
accepted.description:
Hello / 안녕하세요~
Product Designer / 프로덕트 디자이너

plugins.tagline: Batch change icon stroke sizes.

plugins.name: Vertical Trim Cap Height Scanner
plugins.description:
This plugin makes it easy to find text that has had "Cap Height to baseline" vertical trim applied with the click of a button.

It's a useful tool to find and fix incorrectly applied text trims.


How to use:

  1. Click the button on the page you want to search.
  2. Click on trimmed text to select it and modify manually.
  3. Click the button again to confirm the text no longer appears in results.


Tips for fixes:

  1. Be careful when changing trim settings to "Standard" as it may cause layout shifts.
  2. Start by fixing text with the "Main component" tag first.


日本語訳

ボタンをクリックするだけで、上下トリミングに「ベースラインまでのキャップハイト」が設定されているテキストを見つけることができます。

誤って上下トリミングを設定してしまった時に便利なツールです。


使い方：

  1. 検索したいページでボタンをクリックします。
  2. トリミングが設定されたテキストをクリックし、手動で修正します。
  3. 再度ボタンをクリックし、検索結果に表示されなくなったことを確認します。


修正時のコツ：

  1. トリミングを標準に変更するとレイアウトシフトが発生するので、慎重に修正しましょう。
  2. 「メインコンポーネント」タグのついたテキストから先に修正するのがおすすめです。
plugins.tagline: Search for text with "Cap height to baseline" set for vertical trim

131197.name: Vertical Trim Cap Height Scanner
131197.description:

It's a useful tool to find and fix incorrectly applied text trims.

  2. Click on trimmed text to select it and modify manually.
  3. Click the button again to confirm the text no longer appears in results.

  2. Start by fixing text with the "Main component" tag first.

plugins.name: Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Make your designs accessible to everyone with this comprehensive accessibility checker. This plugin combines automated testing with guided manual review to ensure your designs meet accessibility standards.


🔍 AUTOMATED CHECKS

- Text contrast analysis against backgrounds

- Font size verification for readability

- Overlapping elements detection

- Missing alt text detection


✅ INTERACTIVE CHECKLIST

Track your progress with a persistent checklist covering key accessibility criteria:

- Contrast and readability

- Color usage and clarity

- Image descriptions and alt text

- Language simplicity

- Animation limits

- Overall design clarity


💡 EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES

Each accessibility issue includes a direct link to relevant WCAG guidelines and best practices to help you learn while you design.


Perfect for designers who want to create more inclusive products and ensure compliance with accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1). This plugin makes accessibility checking a seamless part of your design workflow rather than an afterthought.


Whether you're new to accessibility or an experienced designer, this tool helps you identify and fix issues early in the design process, saving development time and creating better experiences for all users.
plugins.tagline: Create accessible designs with automated checks and guided review

122490.name: Accessibility Checker
122490.description:
Make your designs accessible to everyone with this comprehensive accessibility checker. This plugin combines automated testing with guided manual review to ensure your designs meet accessibility standards.


🔍 AUTOMATED CHECKS

- Text contrast analysis against backgrounds

- Font size verification for readability

- Overlapping elements detection

- Missing alt text detection


✅ INTERACTIVE CHECKLIST

Track your progress with a persistent checklist covering key accessibility criteria:

- Contrast and readability

- Color usage and clarity

- Image descriptions and alt text

- Language simplicity

- Animation limits

- Overall design clarity


💡 EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES

Each accessibility issue includes a direct link to relevant WCAG guidelines and best practices to help you learn while you design.


Perfect for designers who want to create more inclusive products and ensure compliance with accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1). This plugin makes accessibility checking a seamless part of your design workflow rather than an afterthought.


Whether you're new to accessibility or an experienced designer, this tool helps you identify and fix issues early in the design process, saving development time and creating better experiences for all users.

plugins.name: Wally Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Looking for an easy way to make your designs accessible without compromising creativity?

Our all-new plugin makes it simple to instantly add accessibility to your designs, allowing you to focus on what matters most—creating outstanding user interfaces that are usable by all.

Automatically detect and resolve a wide range of accessibility issues, eliminating the need for manual compliance checks. With real-time feedback, your designs are accessible from the start, saving you both time and effort.

By prioritizing accessibility from the beginning, you’ll create impactful, user-friendly designs that engage and serve every user. Creating visually compelling, fully inclusive designs has never been easier.
plugins.tagline: Create accessible designs with ease

plugins.name: Gradient Ideas
plugins.description:
Gradient Generator

Easily generate customizable idea squares with beautiful random gradients! Choose the number of squares and the gradient direction (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) directly from the plugin's minimalist interface. Perfect for brainstorming sessions, design inspiration, or quick visual placeholders.


Key Features:

  1. Create up to 50 squares with a single click.
  2. Random gradients with unique colors and opacity.
  3. Select gradient direction: Horizontal, Vertical, or Diagonal.
  4. Minimalist and user-friendly design.


Elevate your designs with a splash of creativity. Try it now!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create idea boxes with unique random gradients – customizable and beautifully simple!

plugins.name: Showcase
plugins.description:
Showcase makes presenting specific frames to your team effortless. Whether you’re walking through a design or highlighting a particular frame, Showcase lets you do so directly within the canvas, offering smooth flyover animations for a seamless presentation. Independent of the zoom level, you have full control over how close or far you view your frames—adjust zoom as desired.


Showcase is also helpful when working with large files that contain many frames. If you ever feel lost in the canvas, Showcase helps you quickly focus on a specific frame by simply selecting it from the layers panel.


Showcase is free to use. If you find it helpful, consider supporting the project by buying me a coffee ☕️.

accepted.name: Saleh KAYYALI
accepted.description: Hey 👋🏼  I'm an interaction designer with a passion for nifty productivity tools.

plugins.tagline: Present your Figma frames effortlessly.

plugins.name: .dot
plugins.description:
.dot is a design command line tool that integrates with Figma, transforming the quick actions menu into a powerful command line interface. With .dot, designers can seamlessly access Tailwind functions, apply colors, and perform a wide range of tasks with speed and efficiency—bringing coding-like control to Figma's design environment.


Example Usage:

  1. It's easy, With a frame select type Cmd + P and .
  2. Choose the .dot plugin
  3. Type 'flex p-8 rounded-md bg-zinc-500' to create a styled container

accepted.name: Matthew Ortega
accepted.description:
A studio exploring technology to invent new forms of art & design

Figma training & design systems @ Fabric Co.

plugins.tagline: Supercharge Figma with Tailwind and custom commands at your fingertips.

plugins.name: Hash Renamer
plugins.description: This plugin that changes layer names throughout the entire document to unique hash codes. It facilitates component searching when swapping components.
plugins.tagline: Change layer names to unique hash codes.

61150.name: Hash Renamer
61150.description: This plugin that changes layer names throughout the entire document to unique hash codes. It facilitates component searching when swapping components.

plugins.name: Shape Blur Gradient
plugins.description:
ShapeBlur Gradient helps you create stunning, organic gradients by automatically generating and blending blurred geometric shapes.

With just a few clicks, you can:

  1. Instantly generate unique, soft gradients based on overlapping shapes
  2. Customize colors, number of shapes, blur intensity, and layout
  3. Achieve modern, mesh-style backgrounds and decorative elements
  4. Save time compared to manual shape and blur creation


Perfect for UI designers, illustrators, and anyone looking to add depth and vibrancy to their designs.



Source: https://github.com/midler/ShapeBlurGradient

Features, bugs: figma@midler.xyz

Telegram: @midler
plugins.tagline: Create beautiful blurred gradients from geometric shapes

plugins.name: Mendly — Merge & Fix Broken Variables
plugins.description:
**Streamline your design system maintenance with powerful variable management tools.**


## Key Features


**🔄 Smart Variable Merging**

- Combine duplicate color variables into one

- Automatically updates all references throughout your design

- Preserves semantic variable relationships

- Optional renaming during merge process


**🔧 Broken Variable Detection & Repair**

- Scans current page for broken variable references

- Smart suggestions based on variable naming patterns

- Navigate between elements using the same broken variable

- Batch fix multiple variables at once


**⚡ Intelligent Analysis**

- Shows direct vs semantic variable usage

- Counts affected elements before merging

- Identifies variable dependencies

- Context-aware replacement suggestions


**🎯 Perfect For**

- Design system cleanup and maintenance

- Removing duplicate variables after design updates

- Fixing broken references after variable deletions

- Streamlining color variable organization


**💡 How It Works**

1. Select source variable (will be removed) and target variable (will remain)

2. Preview affected elements and usage statistics

3. Merge variables with one click - all references automatically update

4. Use the fix tool to repair any broken variable links


Save hours of manual work and keep your design system clean and organized!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly merge duplicate variables and fix broken references in your design system.
